item.title: Habit Creation: From Ideas to Action
item.description: In July 2019, I finally got my hands on James Clear’s Atomic Habits, a book around which there has been much furore. I had a vague premonition, or rather, a sense of resignation, that I would forget the content just as quickly as I had absorbed it, as has been the case with many books I’ve read before (think Malcolm Gladwell). I sat comfortably on the library lawns outside the Doheny Library at USC on a warm afternoon and started off.
